Shadows of Verona takes Shakespeare’s beloved tragedy and brings it into a gritty, neon-lit future where rival corporations replace feuding families. With immersive staging, original music, and a diverse cast, this reimagining explores themes of loyalty, rebellion, and doomed passion in a world on the brink.

Whether you're a longtime fan of the Bard or discovering this story for the first time, this bold adaptation will leave you breathless.

record.field: The Curious Case of Lord Patterwick

When eccentric aristocrat Lord Patterwick disappears on the night of his annual masquerade ball, it’s up to his bumbling staff and bizarre guests to unravel the mystery before morning tea. Featuring fast-paced dialogue, over-the-top characters, and physical comedy, this original farce will have audiences laughing from curtain to curtain.

Perfect for fans of Agatha Christie, Monty Python, and mystery novels with a dash of nonsense.

The People Upstairs follows three residents in an old apartment building whose lives intertwine after a tragic loss in their community. Through quiet conversations, missed connections, and unexpected kindness, they confront loneliness, legacy, and the simple need to be heard.

With minimalist staging and powerful performances, this original piece explores the beauty of human connection in the everyday.
